sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Meet the latest graduate of King's College!
I probly shouldn't brag, but, dag, I amaze and astonish!
The scholars say I got the same virtuosity and brains as my pops!
The ladies say my brains not where the resemblance stops!
I'm only nineteen but my mind is older
Gotta be my own man, like my father, but bolder
I shoulder his legacy with pride
I used to hear him say
That someday
I would

sp.speaker: ENSEMBLE
sp.l: Blow us all away

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Ladies, I'm lookin for a Mr. George Eacker
Made a speech last week, our Fourth of July speaker
He disparaged my father's legacy in front of a crowd
I can't have that, I'm making my father proud

sp.speaker: MARTHA
sp.l: I saw him just up Broadway a couple of blocks
He was goin' to see a play

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Well, I'll go visit his box

sp.speaker: DOLLY
sp.l: God, you're a fox

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: And y'all look pretty good in ya frocks
How 'bout when I get back, we all strip down to our socks?

sp.speaker: DOLLY AND MARTHA
sp.l: Ok!

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: Blow us all away!

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: George!

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.l: Shh

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: George!

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.l: Shh! I'm tryin' to watch the show!

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Ya shoulda watched your mouth before you
Talked about my father though!

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.l: I didn't say anything that wasn't true
Your father's a scoundrel, and so, it seems, are you

sp.speaker: ENSEMBLE
sp.l: Ooooooooooh!

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: It's like that?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.l: Yeah, I don't fool around
I'm not your little schoolboy friends

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: See you on the dueling ground
That is, unless you wanna step outside and go now

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.l: I know where to find you, piss off
I'm watchin this show now
Shh

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Pops, if you had only heard the shit he said about you
I doubt you would have let it slide and I was not about to

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Slow down

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: I came to ask you for advice. This is my very first duel
They don't exactly cover this subject in boarding school

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Did your friends attempt to negotiate a peace?

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: He refused to apologize, we had to let the peace talks cease

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Where is this happening?

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Across the river, in Jersey

sp.speaker: HAMILTON/PHILIP
sp.l: Everything is legal in New Jersey

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Alright. So this is what youre gonna do:
Stand there like a man until Eacker is in front of you
When the time comes, fire your weapon in the air
This will put an end to the whole affair

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: But what if he decides to shoot? Then I'm a goner

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: No. He'll follow suit if he's truly a man of honor
To take someone's life, that is something you can't shake
Philip, your mother can't take another heartbreak

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Father

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Promise me. You don't want this
Young man's blood on your conscience

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Okay, I promise

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: Come back home when you're done
Take my guns. Be smart. Make me proud, son

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: My name is Philip
I am a poet
I'm a little nervous, but I can't show it
I'm sorry, I'm a Hamilton with pride
You talk about my father, I cannot let it slide
Mister Eacker! How was the rest of your show?

sp.speaker: GEORGE
sp.l: I'd rather skip the pleasantries
Let's go
Grab your pistol

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Confer with your men
The duel will commence after we count to ten

sp.speaker: ENSEMBLE
sp.l: Count to ten!

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Look 'em in the eye, aim no higher
Summon all the courage you require
Then slowly and clearly aim your gun towards the sky

sp.speaker: MALE ENSEMBLE
sp.l: One two three four

sp.speaker: FULL ENSEMBLE
sp.l: Five six seven
